definitions.body: :Ge 15:5 star (NH id.; Aram. [[כּוֹכְבָא]], [[כּוֹכַבְתָּא]] kb4b:, kawkbo0, fem. form specifically of planet Venus, v. also We:Skizzen iii. 36, 38; Ar. kawkabto0 gen. of single stars and prob. Aram. kawkabun loan-word, We:Skizzen iii. 173; Eth. kokab:; prob. for …[[כבכב]] v. Mahri kubkob, kobkib, etc., Maltzan:ZMG 1873, 227 and As. kakkabu Dl:HWB 336; Pun. kakaboum (Dioscorides), name of a plant, prob. from shape of seed-cup, Blau:ZMG xxvii, 1873, 529; on formation cf. Nö:M § 109 Ba:NB § 138. 1)—´[[כ]] abs. Nu 24:17; cstr. [[כּוֹכַב]] Am 5:26; pl. [[כּוֹכָבִים]] Ge 1:16 + 19 t.; cstr. [[כּוֹכְבֵי]] ([[כּׂכְבֵי]]) Ge 22:17 + 13 t.; [[כּׂכְבֵיהֶם]] Ez Eze 32:7; —sg. only [[אֱלֽהֵיכֶם]] ´[[כ]] Am 5:26 (where, however, ´[[כ]] is prob. a gloss, so GFM Dec. 19, 1890, and now We; v. further [[כִּיּוּן]]); and [[מִיַּעֲקׂב]] ´[[כ]] Nu 24:12 (JE; ‖[[שֵׁבֶט בישׂראל]], metaph. of future ruler); elsewhere pl. stars, ‖ sun and moon (cf. also infr.) Ge 1:16 (P) Ps 136:9 (to rule the night, cf. Ge 1:16), Je 31:35, Ge 37:9 (E), Joseph's dream (´[[אַחַד עָשָׂר כ]] = 11 brethren); De 4:19 obj. of idol. worship (cf. infr.); observed in augury ´[[הַחׂזִים בַּכּ]] Is 47:13 (of Babylon); Ec 12:2 (‖ (also) light; fig. of brightness of youth); ‖ sun Job 9:7; ‖ moon Ps 8:4; sign of evening Ne 4:15 (´[[מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר עַד חֵאת הַכּ]]) cf. [[כּוֹכְבֵי נִשְׁכּוֹ]] Job 3:9 (appar. sign of dawn); numbered by God Ps 147:4; sim. of abundant posterity, Ge 15:5, Ge 22:17, Ge 26:4, Ex 32:13 (all JE); of Isr. De 1:10, De 10:22, De 28:62, 1Ch 27:32, Ne 9:23; of number of merchants of Nineveh Na 3:16; as lofty, Job 22:12; so in fig. of haughty nations Ob:Ob 4, Is 14:13; cf. symbolic vision of Dn (‖[[חָבָא]], [[חְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם]]) Da 8:10; sim. of brightness of righteous Da 12:3; not pure ([[זַכּוּ]]) before God Job 25:5 (‖ moon); darkened in Yahweh's judgment Joe 2:10, Joe 3:15, Ez Eze 32:7 (‖ sun and moon; so) Is 13:10 (‖ also [[כְּסִילֵיהֶם]]); personified: as fighting Ju Jdg 5:20; shouting Job 38:7 ([[בְּרָן־יַחַד כּוֹבֵי בׂקֶר]], ‖[[בְּנֵי אֱלֽחִים]]); praising Ps 148:3 ([[כּוֹכְבֵי אוֹר]], ‖ sun and moon).—On stars in Arab. mythol. v. We:Skizzen iii. 173 f.
